1.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

2.text: Can a man be profitable to God, as he that is wise may be profitable to himself?

3.text: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

4.text: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

5.text: Is not thy wickedness great? and thy iniquities infinite?

6.text: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for naught, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

7.text: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withheld bread from the hungry.

8.text: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honorable man dwelt in it.

9.text: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

10.text: Therefore snares are around thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

11.text: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

12.text: Is not God in the hight of heaven? and behold the hight of the stars, how high they are!

13.text: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

14.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

15.text: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

16.text: Who were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflowed with a flood!

17.text: Who said to God, depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them!

18.text: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

19.text: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent deride them.

20.text: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

21.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: by this good shall come to thee.

22.text: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thy heart.

23.text: If thou shalt return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

24.text: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

25.text: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defense and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

26.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face to God.

27.text: Thou shalt make thy prayer to him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

28.text: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established to thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

29.text: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is exaltation; and he shall save the humble person.

30.text: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thy hands.
